definition: (bird species of China) Barbary falcon (Falco pelegrinoides)
(bird species of China) rufous-bellied eagle (Lophotriorchis kienerii)
(bird species of China) peregrine falcon (Falco peregrinus)
(bird species of China) Eurasian hobby (Falco subbuteo)
(bird species of China) oriental hobby (Falco severus)
(bird species of China) saker falcon (Falco cherrug)
(bird species of China) Bonelli's eagle (Aquila fasciata)
(bird species of China) pied falconet (Microhierax melanoleucos)
(bird species of China) Amur falcon (Falco amurensis)
(bird species of China) collared falconet (Microhierax caerulescens)
(bird species of China) common kestrel (Falco tinnunculus)
(bird species of China) Jerdon's baza (Aviceda jerdoni)

sentences.english: In April 2007, HAYABUSA started full cruising operation to return to earth.
sentences.chinese: 2007年4月，隼巡航开始全面运作，以返回地球。

sentences.english: The original Hayabusa was the best.
I also have a feather from another species making a comeback against the odds, the peregrine falcon.
sentences.chinese: 我还有一支游隼羽毛，这是另一个被挽救的生物种类。

sentences.english: Accelerated by gravity, a bird closes its wings and plunges at quarry.
sentences.chinese: 通过重力来加速，隼收紧翅膀飞向猎物。

sentences.english: Well, that day they were playing the Falcons, and the Bears were in white.
sentences.chinese: 那天小熊队和隼鹰队比赛，小熊队穿白衣服。

sentences.english: Every age, vegetation, as severe drought during is extremely rabbit dead, group of hawk Xiao auction abdomen.
sentences.chinese: 岁逢大旱，草木尽枯，獐兔竞死，群隼枵腹。

sentences.english: The Dark Lord confronted Kenobi as the Jedi was returning to the Falcon.
sentences.chinese: 黑暗尊主在这位绝地返回千年隼时截住了他。

sentences.english: Close observation is required to assess what breeding behaviour is taking place.
sentences.chinese: 要密切关注隼呈现出的繁殖行为。

sentences.english: So have such impressive species as the peregrine falcon and the American alligator.
sentences.chinese: 像这样给人深刻印象的动物还有游隼和美洲鳄。

sentences.english: Once the Peregrine enters a breeding pen its energy requirements drop.
sentences.chinese: 一旦游隼进入育种栏，它的能源需求就会下降。

sentences.english: It took about six weeks for the eyas to mature into a fully grown peregrine falcon.
sentences.chinese: 雏鹰成长为一只完全成熟的游隼大概需要六周的时间。

sentences.english: I realized I cherished what the sight of the falcons did for my Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 我认识到，对游隼的观察于我的精神世界意味着什么。

sentences.english: Lando, aboard the Falcon, flew point into the twisting narrow corridors of the Death Star's innards.
sentences.chinese: 兰多驾驶千年隼飞进死星内部扭曲狭窄的通道。

sentences.english: A common kestrel chases a barn owl, which is carrying a mouse.
sentences.chinese: 一只普通的红隼追逐着一只刁着老鼠的仓鸮。

sentences.english: Females of the genus Falco are larger and Bolder than males and are preferred for falconry .
sentences.chinese: 真隼的雌鸟个体较大，较凶猛，故鹰猎者喜用雌隼。

sentences.english: Females of the genus Falco are larger and Bolder than males and are preferred for falconry .
sentences.chinese: 真隼的雌鸟个体较大，较凶猛，故鹰猎者喜用雌隼。

definition: wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌
surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)
wild beast/wild horse/lion/trad. form used erroneously for 貌/simplified form used erroneously for 狻
